resources.string:
Welcome to the 449 Blair Robot Project Scouting/Refereeing App!

For each match, you will be assigned a team to scout. Watch this robot closely throughout the match, and record what they do.
On each page, fill out the fields, and then move on by swiping or with the navigation buttons at the bottom.

When you are done, hit the submit button.
If you realise you entered something wrong after submitting, you can edit it. Hit the edit icon at the top of the screen and select the match you want to edit. Any data you entered for the next match will be preserved for when you finish editing.

On many questions you will see a ? icon. Click this to get more information about that field
If you need more help with something, don't hesitate to ask a scouting leader.
Select if the robot was not on the field at all for this match
Select if some portion of the bumper crossed the line formed by the edges of the 2 closest zones to the robot during auto

This is a drawing of the goal, with counters for different places the ball can go. Every ball that the robot shoots should be marked once in one of the four counters. Click on the yellow circles to increment the ball count. If you made a mistake, you can use the -1 button underneath to decrement the counter.

Bottom left: this is the low goal, that looks like an elongated octagon. 

Bottom right: count all balls that are shot but don't go into any goal here. 

Top left: this is the high goal (the hexagonal one). Only count balls here if they went out the sides of the goal, not if they went through the small centered hole behind the goal. 

Top right: this is the center goal, a small circle behind the main high goal. Some balls that make it into the high goal will then also make it into this center goal. These shouldn't be marked in the hexagonal goal, only here. Each ball should only be counted once.

As a scout lead if you need more help understanding this section.
Select if the robot spun the color wheel 3 \- 5 times to complete stage two
Select if the robot spun the color wheel to a particular color to complete stage three
Whether or not the robot reached its alliance\'s alliance zone by the end of the endgame
What was the final score in the \"endgame\" category for the entire alliance? You will have to wait until after the match when the scores are posted.

ALIVE: the robot was enabled, moving, and mostly functional for most of the match.

BROKEN: robot was moving, but something is wrong. There are parts of their robot that are clearly broken.

SOMETIMES DEAD: dead for a significant portion of the match (around 35â€“70%).

DEAD: the robot is just sitting on the field unable to move.

Did the robot play any defense?

This refers to the robot attempting to stop the opposing alliance from scoring, or slow them down, even if it was ineffective.

NONE: the robot never played defense

PART: the robot played defense for part of the match, but also spend some time not trying to block the opponent (though not necessarily scoring points).

ALL: the robot played defense for all or nearly all of the Teleop period (not necessarily Auto or Endgame)
Are you sure you want to clear all data? This action cannot be undone
Are you sure you want to clear the team list and match schedule? This action cannot be undone
